description: Unique primary key identifying the maintenance procedure record.
Human-readable procedure code or short name indicating the scheduled service or program.
Narrative summary of the procedure’s scope, tasks, or intent.
Likely categorizes procedure type (e.g., preventive, inspection, corrective); confirm with SME.
Numeric status code for the procedure’s lifecycle (e.g., active, inactive, retired); confirm code set.
Numeric priority used for scheduling/dispatch; lower numbers may indicate higher urgency; confirm scale.
Default warehouse/location identifier for issuing parts or materials tied to this procedure; confirm mapping.
Flag indicating whether the work is warranty-related (1) or not (0); confirm encoding.
Indicates if the procedure can be performed while the asset is operating (1=yes, 0=no).
Indicates if the procedure requires the asset to be out of service (1=yes, 0=no).
Estimated additional downtime hours beyond hands-on labor (e.g., cool-down, cure time, staging).
User ID of the person who most recently updated the procedure.
System timestamp of the most recent modification to this procedure record.
Despite the name, values appear to be datetimes; likely last modification timestamp recorded by the application; confirm with SME.
User ID that originally created the procedure record.
Timestamp when the procedure record was initially created.
User ID that last modified the procedure record.
Timestamp of the most recent user-driven modification to this procedure.
